Welcome to Arawa Lexical Database (ALeD)



Arawa is a small language family spoken by a few ethnic groups in south-western Amazonia in Brazil (except for the Kulina speakers, who live near the Peruvian border, Ucayali). The Arawa Lexical Database (ALeD) was created with the goal of providing a comprehensive list of words in a unified transcription and further enriched with information on cognacy and is the first part of the Arawa Languages Resources Projet (ArLaR) to be made public.. Following the publication of the first database of South American languages, Tupían Lexical Database (TuLeD), we intend to help preserve data on Arawa languages for future generations as well for scholarly research by adding manually curated lexical, moprhological, and syntactic data for linguistic analysis. We invite and welcome suggestions, feedback, and collaborations.

Additional Information

The Arawa Lexical Database (ALeD) is the first part of the Arawa Languages Resources Project (ArLaR) to be made public. Its goal is to provide data (lexical, moprhological, and syntactic) for linguistic analysis. For suggestions, feedback, and possible collaborations please contact us or open an issue in our repository on GutHub.
